journal.name: Journal
journal.desc:
This is Joe's Journal.

Joe keeps track of everything here.

press_card.name: Press Card
press_card.desc:
Joe Constantino,
Reporter for The Times.

Valid until: August 1971

Without this, the guards at Congress
won't let him in.

wallet.name: Wallet
wallet.desc:
A typical Filipino wallet.

Contains a few hundred pesos, identific
-ation cards, and pictures of family.

flashlight.name: Flashlight
flashlight.desc: Can be used to shine light on dark areas.

estimate_count.name: Number of demonstrators
estimate_count.desc:
If you’d ask me, I’d say there’s around
20,000 of them.

no_guns.name: No guns
no_guns.desc:
Being with the demonstrators did not
make me feel uneasy.

None of them carried guns.

podium_nusp.name: NUSP President
podium_nusp.desc:
He’s Edgar Jopson, the head of the
National Union of Students of
the Philippines (NUSP).

effigies_general.name: Creative effigies
effigies_general.desc:
The student activists are at it again with
their effigies.

What could the coffin represent?

e1.title: SONA Location
e1.description:
IT WAS FIVE MINUTES PAST FIVE in the afternoon,
by the clock on the Maharnilad tower, when I
arrived at [?].

e1.title: Session Hall Doors
e1.description: The doors of the session hall were [?].

e1.title: Crowd Estimate
e1.description:
There were, according to conservative estimates,
 at least [?] of them, perhaps even 50,000.

e1.title: Speaker
e1.description:
There were two mikes, taped together; … They were
in the hands of [?] Jopson of the National Union of Students of the Philippines,
the group that had organized the rally and secured the permit for it.

e1.title: Demonstrators' guns
e1.description:
Among the demonstrators it was possible to feel at
ease. [?] of them carried guns, they didn’t stand on ceremony,
 and there was no need for the aura of privilege that a press badge automatically
confers on its wearer.

e1.title: Chief Objective
e1.description: Its chief objective was to demand [?].

e1.title: Effigies
e1.description:
WHERE THE DEMONSTRATION LEADERS STOOD, emblems of the
enemy were prominently displayed: a cardboard [?] representing the
death of democracy at the hands of the goonstabulary in the last elections.

e1.title: Weapons in the Chaos
e1.description:
The demonstrators who got as far as the sidewalk that led
to the Muni golf links started to pick up pebbles and rocks with
which they pelted the police. Very soon, placards had
turned into missiles, and the sound of broken glass punctuated the yelling [?] were flying, too. The effigy was down on the ground, still burning.

e1.title: Perception of cops
e1.description: … the cops are generally believed to be [?]

e1.title: Demonstartors' vehicle
e1.description:
The demonstrators had hired a [?] in which rode some of
their leaders. It had two loudspeakers on its roof,
was surrounded by students, and inched its way
forward and backward throughout the melee.

e1.title: Cops actions
e1.description:
When the cops were through [?] the jeepney’s passengers,
they backed away.

e1.title: Injured People Count
e1.description:
More than [?] demonstrators with bloody heads
and broken wrists had been or were being treated along with
three or four policemen hit by rocks.

joe_intro2.text: I need to make sure that I didn’t forget anything before I go.

joe_target_board.text:
The bulletin board. Everyone's kept up to date with everything
that's happening, thanks to that.

joe_newspapers.text: They keep copies of today's edition in the rack.

joe_joe.text: I don't think anything useful will come out of clicking me.

joe_light1.text: There's nothing wrong with the light fixtures, as far as I'm concerned.

joe_light2.text: They are your standard, run-of-the-mill lights.

joe_tut2.text:
You might want to CLICK on the desk and take everything that's
important: my press card, journal, pen, and the like.

joe_desk.text: Let's see... I'll take my press card, journal, pen, and wallet.

joe_item_stapler.text: I don't really need to take a stapler with me.

joe_item_wallet.text: I inherited this from my father. It surely stood the test of time.

joe_item_reports.text: I need to bring this to the archives. On second thought, maybe later.

joe_item_typewriter.text: An Olympia typewriter. This is where I write all my draft reports.

joe_item_mail.text: I don't have anything new at the moment.

joe_item_pencils.text: Of course, I couldn't write without a pen.

joe_item_pencils_empty.text: All that's left is a couple of pencils.

joe_item_papers.text: A pile of empty papers waiting for something to be written.

joe_item_journal.text: Got it. I can't leave without my journal.

joe_item_press_card.text: Yes, that’s me. Joe Constantino, reporting for The Times.

joe_item_note.text: The note says the place of my assignment.

joe_item_flashlight.text: This flashlight will certainly be useful in the future.

joe_return.text: On second thought, I might have forgotten something.

joe_choice1.text: Manong, take me to Luneta Park.

joe_choice2.text: Manong, take me to the Congress building.

driver_choice2.text:
I can only give you a ride until Luneta. The entire stretch of the road is
occupied by demonstrators.

joe_choice3_2.text: On second thought, I don’t need to go home right now.

driver_choice3_5.text: Where are you headed to, then?

driver_pay1.text: We’re here, sir. Pay up, please.

joe_pay1.text: Let me just get my wallet.

joe_pay2b.text: It looks like I forgot my wallet.

joe_text2.text: It’s already five minutes past five.

joe_target_speaker.text: The president’s already delivering his SONA message.

joe_target_estimate_count.text: If you’d ask me, I’d say there’s around 20,000 of them.

joe_target_no_guns.text: None of the demonstrators carried guns.

joe_target_effigies.text: The student activists are at it again with their effigies.

joe_target_person_speaking1.text:
He’s Edgar Jopson, the head of the National Union of Students
of the Philippines (NUSP).

joe_target_person_speaking2.text: They’re the group that organized and secured a permit for the rally.

joe_target_police.text:
They’re uniformed policemen, swinging their long rattan sticks, along
with members of the riot squad.

joe_intro.text: I'm Joe Constantino, from The Times. You need my press card?

police_mac_wp_1.text: Unfortunately, Mr. Constantino, the session hall is already closed.

police_mac_wp_2.text:
Letting you in means letting everyone in, including those photographers who
arrived late. We cannot let you and everyone else disturb the order inside.

joe_np_1.text:
Uh. It’s not in my pockets. I seem to have forgotten my press card at my desk back
in the office.

police_mac_np_1.text: You must be one of the militants pretending to be with the press.

police_mac_np_2.text: Please leave now if you don’t want any trouble.

joe_intro.text: Maybe I should speak with one of the demonstrators instead.

joe_talk1.text: I'm from The Times, and I’d like to get your thoughts about this demonstration.

joe_q1_text1.text: You’re a member of what organization?

joe_q1_accuse_talk1.text:
You’re lying. The truth is, you’re an undercover communist seeking to
destabilize the government!

dan_q1_accuse_talk2.text: That doesn’t make any sense at all!

joe_q2_talk1.text: What’s the objective of this demonstration?

dan_q2_talk1.text:
We are here to appeal for a nonpartisan Constitutional Convention from
the president and to ask him to refrain from running for a third term.

joe_q2_doubt_talk1.text:
That’s all? There must be something more to your cause. You’re not
planning on overthrowing the government aren’t you?

dan_q2_doubt_talk1.text: Not true. You’ve a very wide imagination, Sir Joe.

joe_q2_accuse_talk1.text:
That’s all? There must be something more to your cause. You’re not
planning on overthrowing the government aren’t you?

joe_q3_talk1.text: For you, what does the effigies symbolize?

dan_q3_talk1.text: The cardboard coffin represents the death of democracy.

dan_q3_talk2.text:
While the cardboard crocodile symbolizes his cronies and the greed of
congressmen for money.

joe_q3_doubt_talk1.text: The coffin… You’re not planning on placing the president inside it, no?

dan_q3_doubt_talk1.text: Where are these questions coming from?

joe_q3_accuse_talk1.text: The coffin… You’re not planning on placing the president inside it, no?

dan_q4_talk1.text:
I’m not really that familiar with everyone here, but there’s KM
(Kabataan Makabayan) and the SDK (Samahang Demokratiko ng Kabataan).

joe_q4_doubt_talk1.text: I don’t think so. You know them because you’re with them.

dan_q4_doubt_talk1.text: That doesn’t make any sense. Being here doesn’t mean that I know everyone here.

joe_q4_accuse_talk1.text: I don’t think so. You know them because you’re with them.

joe_q5_talk1.text: What do you think of the cops who are here to “maintain” the peace?

dan_q5_talk1.text:
Two words – corrupt and brutal. They are here to serve only the interests of
the rich and powerful.

joe_q5_doubt_talk1.text:
How did you say that they are brutal? I think it’s the other way around.
You and your organizations are framing them and making them look bad.

dan_q5_doubt_talk1.text: Sir Joe, if you’re here to defend the police, please just go away.

joe_q5_accuse_talk1.text:
How did you say that they are brutal? I think it’s the other way around.
You and your organizations are framing them and making them look bad.

joe_intro.text: It’s probably seven o’clock. It’s difficult to see anything.

joe_target_jeep.text:
It’s likely that the jeep was rented out by the demonstrators.
It had two loudspeakers on the roof.

joe_target_riot_talk2.text:
The cops, wearing crash helmets and carrying wicker shields, were
striking out and beating up the students surrounding the jeepney.

joe_target_demonstrator_talk1.text:
He’s downed and crumpled to the ground, his legs to his chest and his
arms over his head.

joe_target_demonstrator_talk2.text: Is that blood? He must’ve been beaten up by those cops.

cop2_end.text: Come closer and you’ll get what you’re looking for.

doc_intro1.text: PGH, Mr. Constantino. You were brought here after passing out.

joe_target_demonstrator.text:
He's one of them. I’d estimate there’s around thirty or so demonstrators
with bloody heads and broken wrists.

joe_target_nusp_talk1.text:
I thought they’ve left early. It seems like some members of the NUSP
weren’t able to escape the violence.

joe_target_police_talk1.text: I see maybe three to four policemen, possibly hit by rocks.

joe_target_doctor_talk1.text: She’s probably busy speaking with the other patients.

joe_target_door_talk1.text: I’ll be on my way, thank you.
